name: Hikma Health Inc
mission: We partner with nonprofit organizations providing healthcare in underserved and refugee populations. We create customized data systems for these healthc...
theoryOfChange: Hikma Health explicitly states they are "using an implementation science framework to understand the real-world application of our system across a variety of clinical and cultural settings." They are conducting a feasibility study and an effectiveness trial with partners globally to investigate the barriers and facilitators to implementing their system. Additionally, their Health & Environmental Record System (HERS) provides data analytics and modeling tools to empower data-driven decision-making at individual, clinic, population, and environmental levels, aiding in planning and policy decisions to improve public health.

grantsData.purpose: Grant to Parkers Mobile Clinic, a non profit in Nigeria providing healthcare services to deploy the Hikma Health EHR system.

zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" or "zakat donations" was found on the official website or donation pages of Hikma Health, a US-based 501(c)(3) charitable organization. The donation page details general contributions and tax deductibility but does not refer to zakat.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Hikma Health addresses the urgent cause of global health for underserved populations, offering a medium fit for donors interested in technology-driven humanitarian aid [1]. Donors can support these efforts through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization achieves high impact through systemic change by providing the digital infrastructure necessary for refugee healthcare, operating with a low cost per beneficiary [1]. Its financial health is robust, characterized by a 100.0% program expense ratio and 26.0 months of working capital [2].

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has a clear theory of change but lacks multi-year outcome tracking or external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By providing customized EHR systems (HERS) to clinics, Hikma Health enables better patient tracking and data-driven care in refugee settings.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the technology provided actually leads to improved health outcomes for the refugees using the clinics.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a small budget and declining revenue, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding for EHR deployments.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">1.0% of its expenses toward program services</cite>, ensuring maximum mission impact for every dollar spent.
Hikma Health maintains <cite id="8">26.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant safety net for its technology projects.
The charity spends <cite id="5">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite>, indicating that it does not divert donor funds toward marketing or solicitation costs.

strengths_deep_dive: Hikma Health's operational model is built on extreme fiscal leaness and technical focus. By maintaining a <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization stands well above the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 84.6%</cite> for global health nonprofits. This is supported by a <cite id="10">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, which validates their commitment to sharing organizational data. Furthermore, their technical capacity is validated by external support, including <cite id="11">grants from the Sall Family Foundation</cite> and other institutional donors, which fund their <cite id="12">Care Innovation and EHR deployment programs</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Hikma Health Inc. is a specialized health technology nonprofit that addresses the critical data gap in humanitarian medicine by providing <cite id="1">customized data systems to organizations serving refugee populations</cite>. Operating as a technical partner for frontline clinics, the organization develops and deploys the <cite id="2">Health and Environmental Record System (HERS)</cite> and other Electronic Health Record (EHR) solutions designed for low-resource settings. In the 2023 fiscal year, Hikma Health reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $70,494</cite>, reflecting a lean, highly specialized operation. Despite its modest budget, the organization achieves significant financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 100.0%</cite>, meaning every dollar spent is directed toward its core mission of health technology deployment. This efficiency is further evidenced by its <cite id="5">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, as the organization relies on grants and direct support rather than expensive public solicitation. By focusing on <cite id="6">systemic change through implementation science research</cite> and policy data mapping, Hikma Health aims to modernize healthcare delivery for the most vulnerable, currently focusing its geographic reach on <cite id="7">underserved populations in Nicaragua</cite>.
